page.title: 03A CHILD'S DAY IN NAG'S HEAD
page.content: My name is Adam Dowding and I am ten. I got up at 7.45 a.m. and had cereal, toast and apple juice. After dressing in T-shirt, jeans, sweater and training shoes, my Dad took me to Minchinhampton School by car. I went into assembly and then I went upstairs to do graphs. During play-time I ate crisps and afterwards I wrote a story about dinosaurs in Cheltenham. For lunch I had meat sandwiches, chocolate biscuits and flap-jack and I watched tadpoles in the pond. Then I drew a map of France and read an adventure book. I went home at 3.15 p.m. and watched tennis on television with my Dad. Later I played tennis with a friend then, after I had watched more television, I put on my red pyjamas, had a cup of tea and went to sleep.
